title: Selling a Restaurant Wine List Without Closing the Business
metaTitle: Sell Restaurant Wine Inventory | Cash Flow | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Need to raise cash or reformat your wine list? You don't have to close to sell inventory. Learn how to sell off back-vintages discreetly.
summary: How to sell part of a cellar responsibly with clean records and minimal disruption.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Smart restaurateurs actively manage their cellar assets. Selling off non-performing 'Verticals' or 'Trophy Bottles' is a standard business move to generate operating capital.
list: Identify slow movers with high asset value (e.g., 10-year-old Burgundy).
Sell to a private collector/dealer (us) to avoid market noise.
Reinvest the cash into faster-moving inventory.
No signage needed—customers won't even notice.

sections.heading: Thinning the List
list: Verticals: Do you really need 10 vintages of Opus One? Keep 3, sell 7.
Orphans: Single bottles that clutter the list.
Format: Magnums that never sell.

sections.heading: Discretion and Reputation
content: You don't want rumors that you are 'selling the furniture'.
list: We are 100% discreet. No trucks with 'LIQUIDATION' banners.
We pay promptly so it hits your books as revenue.
We respect the 'Sommelier's curated list'—we act as a scalpel, not a sledgehammer.

sections.heading: Compliance
list: In most states, a retail licensee can sell to another licensee.
Or we purchase the 'private collection' assets if they were held separately.
Always keep the Bill of Sale for your liquor authority audit.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Keeping wine until it passes its peak drinking window (value drops).
Storing expensive wine in a hot server station.
Ignoring the 'Opportunity Cost' of tying up $50k in dead stock.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Mark the bottles on your inventory sheet.
Send the list for valuation.
We verify, pay, and pickup.
You have cash for payroll or new menu updates.

faqs.question: Do I need to de-list them first?
faqs.answer: Yes, remove them from your POS availability before we pickup.

faqs.question: Can I sell the whole cellar?
faqs.answer: Yes, we do full buyouts too.

faqs.question: Can you pay our vendor directly?
faqs.answer: We pay the license holder (the restaurant entity).
